TEXT: The applicant is an NORP citizen , born in DATE . He is a farmer residing in GPE ( GPE ) . Before the ORG he is represented by Mr. PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the ORG ( Agrarbezirksbehörde - " ORG " ) instituted consolidation proceedings ( PERSON ) for PERSON .
In DATE the applicant received several parcels of land situated in GPE as a donation from third persons . In DATE and DATE he bought further land in GPE .

On DATE ORG , on the basis of a draft consolidation plan , ordered the provisional transfer of compensation parcels . This measure also affected several parcels of the land owned by the applicant and his father . According to an agreement concluded with ORG the applicant 's father , who has the same name as the applicant , PERSON , and had also acted on the applicant ’s behalf , agreed in DATE to the exchange of several parcels of land . The decision of CARDINAL DATE was served on the parties concerned , not by mail but by a circular letter which an employee of ORG ( PERSON ) served on the parties by visiting them . Acknowledgements of receipt were signed .

On DATE ORG by a circular letter informed the CARDINAL owners of land concerned by the consolidation proceedings that a consolidation plan had been drawn up which could be inspected at ORG DATE . During this period appeals against the consolidation plan could be lodged . This circular letter was again not served by mail but by an employee of ORG . On the acknowledgement of receipt under No . CARDINAL the applicant ’s mother is mentioned and there is a signature beside her name . Under No . CARDINAL there is the name “ PERSON ” and the address ORG . Beside his name is a signature which seems to be identical to the one beside No . CARDINAL .

The applicant claims that he did not receive the circular letter . It had been served on another person bearing the same name as the applicant and who had died in the meantime . According to the Government , the circular letter was properly served on the applicant and his mother had signed the receipt in his place .
The applicant 's father filed an appeal against the consolidation plan which he later withdrew . No appeal by the applicant is recorded in the files .
On DATE ORG ( Bezirksgericht ) , acting as the land registry , amended the land register according to the consolidation plan . This decision was served on the applicant .

On DATE ORG issued a decree ( Verordnung ) by which the consolidation proceedings were formally terminated . This decree was published in the official gazette , published at ORG and ORG and entered into force on CARDINAL DATE .

On DATE the applicant sent a letter to ORG . He submitted that he still maintained an appeal he had lodged on DATE and that the amendments entered on the land register were incorrect or invalid . He further announced that after the harvest in DATE he would cultivate his previous parcels of land and requested ORG to re - establish the former borders .

On DATE the applicant appeared before ORG . He submitted a copy of his appeal of DATE and stated that he had handed over the appeal to the civil servant who had directed the land consolidation proceedings . He was informed that no appeal had been found in the files , that by the decree of CARDINAL DATE the land consolidation proceedings had been terminated and that therefore no further decision could be taken . According to the copy of the appeal handed over to the officer of ORG , the applicant had complained that certain parcels of his land were too far away from the land he had received in compensation and that he should keep other parcels which were closer to his farming estate .

On DATE ORG , referring to the applicant ’s letter of CARDINAL May DATE , informed him that no appeal by the applicant against the consolidation plan had ever been received by the authority . The proceedings had become final ( rechtskräftig ) , the land register had been amended accordingly and no further decision relating to the land consolidation proceedings could be taken . The applicant was advised to refrain from any interference with other people ’s land as this would only create serious problems for him .

DATE , on DATE the applicant , assisted by counsel , requested ORG to resume the consolidation proceedings and , in particular , to serve on him ORG circular letter of CARDINAL DATE or , alternatively , the consolidation plan , so that he could appeal against the plan .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's request for lack of competence . On the applicant ’s appeal , ORG ( Landesagrarsenat - " ORG " ) on DATE quashed this decision . On CARDINAL DATE ORG again rejected the applicant 's request and found that , after the publication of the decree of CARDINAL DATE , no further claims concerning the consolidation proceedings could be made .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal and confirmed ORG decision . It noted that , under LAW of ORG ( ORG ) , consolidation proceedings have to be terminated by a decree once all the plan ’s measures , including the changes in the land register ( PERSON ) , have been carried out .

On DATE ORG Verfassungsgerichtshof ) refused to deal with the applicant 's complaint as it found that it had no prospect of success and referred the case to ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) . ORG also found that it had no doubts as to the constitutionality of the decree of CARDINAL DATE since any alleged deficiencies in the communication of the circular letter of DATE could no longer affect the lawfulness of the decree by which the consolidation proceedings had been concluded .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's complaint and confirmed ORG reasoning . ORG found that , as a consequence of the entry into force of ORG decree of CARDINAL DATE , the land consolidation authorities no longer had jurisdiction . Thus the land consolidation authorities were no longer competent to serve the consolidation plan on the applicant .
